required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of an Investigational Zoster Vaccine in Subjects With a History of Varicella (Chickenpox) Given Concomitantly With Another Vaccine (V211-011)
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-Blind, Randomized, Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, and Immunogenicity of V211 Administered Concomitantly Versus Nonconcomitantly With Influenza Virus Vaccine (Inactivated)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether the investigational zoster vaccine has a comparable immune response (the body's ability to protect against disease) and safety profile when given concomitantly with another vaccine.

primary_outcome.measure: Varicella-zoster Virus (VZV) Glycoprotein Enzyme-linked Immunosorbent Assay (gpELISA) Antibody Responses
primary_outcome.description: The Geometric mean titer (GMT) of the VZV glycoprotein enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (gpELISA) antibody responses at Week 4 postvaccination in participants who received ZOSTAVAX™ concomitantly with influenza vaccine was compared to that in subjects who received influenza vaccine and ZOSTAVAX™ nonconcomitantly.

other_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Fold Rise (GMFR) in VZV gpELISA Antibody Titers From Prevaccination to 4 Weeks Postvaccination
other_outcome.description: GMFR of the VZV gpELISA antibody titers from prevaccination to 4 weeks postvaccination when ZOSTAVAX™ is administered concomitantly with influenza vaccine

other_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Titers (GMTs) of H1N1 Strain Antibody Responses at 4 Weeks Postvaccination
other_outcome.description: GMT of the H1N1 strain antibody responses at 4 weeks postvaccination in participants who receive ZOSTAVAX™ concomitantly with influenza vaccine and those who receive ZOSTAVAX™ and influenza vaccine nonconcomitantly

other_outcome.measure: GMTs of H3N2 Strain Antibody Responses at 4 Weeks Postvaccination
other_outcome.description: GMT of the H3N2 strain antibody responses at 4 weeks postvaccination in participants who receive ZOSTAVAX™ concomitantly with influenza vaccine and those who receive ZOSTAVAX™ and influenza vaccine nonconcomitantly

other_outcome.measure: GMTs of B Strain Antibody Responses at 4 Weeks Postvaccination
other_outcome.description: GMT of the B strain antibody responses at 4 weeks postvaccination in participants who receive ZOSTAVAX™ concomitantly with influenza vaccine and those who receive ZOSTAVAX™ and influenza vaccine nonconcomitantly

arm_group.description: Zostavax concomitantly with influenza vaccine on Day 1, placebo at week 4
Influenza vaccine and Zostavax placebo on Day 1, Zostavax at week 4

intervention.description: a single administration of 0.65 mL subcutaneous injection of zoster vaccine live on Day 1 and placebo at Week 4
a single administration of 0.5 mL intramuscular injection of influenza vaccine (inactivated) at Day 1
Placebo injection on Day 1 and a single administration of 0.65 mL subcutaneous injection of zoster vaccine live at Week 4

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults 50 years of age or older
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior history of Herpes Zoster (shingles)
- Prior receipt of varicella or zoster vaccine
- Immunosuppressed

reference.citation: Kerzner B, Murray AV, Cheng E, Ifle R, Harvey PR, Tomlinson M, Barben JL, Rarrick K, Stek JE, Chung MO, Schödel FP, Wang WW, Xu J, Chan IS, Silber JL, Schlienger K. Safety and immunogenicity profile of the concomitant administration of ZOSTAVAX and inactivated influenza vaccine in adults aged 50 and older. J Am Geriatr Soc. 2007 Oct;55(10):1499-507.

Sutradhar SC, Wang WW, Schlienger K, Stek JE, Xu J, Chan IS, Silber JL. Comparison of the levels of immunogenicity and safety of Zostavax in adults 50 to 59 years old and in adults 60 years old or older. Clin Vaccine Immunol. 2009 May;16(5):646-52. doi: 10.1128/CVI.00407-08. Epub 2009 Mar 4.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were recruited at 13 sites in the United States and 7 sites in Europe. First Patient In (FPI): 23-SEP-2005; Last Patient Last Visit (LPLV): 08-MAR-2006

group.title: Concomitant Group
group.description: ZOSTAVAX™ 0.65 mL subcutaneous (SC) injection administered concomitantly with 0.5 mL intramuscular (IM) influenza vaccine injection at separate injection sites on Day 1 and placebo injection at Week 4

group.title: Nonconcomitant Group
group.description: Influenza vaccine 0.5 mL IM injection administerd with placebo injection on Day 1 and ZOSTAVAX™ 0.65 mL SC injection at Week 4

participants_list.participants: One participant was randomized but not vaccinated
Participant received required vaccines and returned completed vaccination report cards at Visits 2&3
Participant received required vaccines and returned completed vaccination report cards at Visits 2&3

group.title: Concomitant Group
group.description: ZOSTAVAX™ 0.65 mL subcutaneous (SC) injection administered concomitantly with 0.5 mL intramuscular (IM) influenza vaccine injection at separate injection sites on Day 1 and placebo injection at Week 4

group.title: Nonconcomitant Group
group.description: Influenza vaccine 0.5 mL IM injection administerd with placebo injection on Day 1 and ZOSTAVAX™ 0.65 mL SC injection at Week 4

outcome.title: Varicella-zoster Virus (VZV) Glycoprotein Enzyme-linked Immunosorbent Assay (gpELISA) Antibody Responses
outcome.description: The Geometric mean titer (GMT) of the VZV glycoprotein enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (gpELISA) antibody responses at Week 4 postvaccination in participants who received ZOSTAVAX™ concomitantly with influenza vaccine was compared to that in subjects who received influenza vaccine and ZOSTAVAX™ nonconcomitantly.
outcome.population: The primary analysis was based on the per protocol population defined as participants who had valid GMT results from samples obtained within the prespecified day ranges at Day 1, at Week 4, or at Week 8 postvaccination, and who did not meet any of the protocol violations prespecified in the statistical analysis plan (SAP).

reported_events.desc: Injection-site adverse events (AEs), rashes, oral temperatures (if the subject felt febrile), and other AEs were recorded by the participant on a Vaccination Report Card which was reviewed by the study site personnel at the end of each 28-day follow-up period. 4 participants from each group were lost to follow up & not included in the analysis

group.title: Concomitant Group
group.description: ZOSTAVAX™ 0.65 mL subcutaneous (SC) injection administered concomitantly with 0.5 mL intramuscular (IM) influenza vaccine injection at separate injection sites on Day 1 and placebo injection at Week 4

group.title: Nonconcomitant Group
group.description: Influenza vaccine 0.5 mL IM injection administerd with placebo injection on Day 1 and ZOSTAVAX™ 0.65 mL SC injection at Week 4

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: Injection Site Erythema (Influenza vaccine injection site)
Injection Site Pain (Influenza vaccine injection site)
Injection Site Swelling (Influenza vaccine injection site)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Merck agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Merck supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
